text: Hussein Monzer (, ; born 20 March 1997) is a Lebanese professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for club Ahed and the Lebanon national team. == International career == Monzer represented the Lebanon national under-20 team during the 2016 AFC U-19 Championship qualification, playing three times and scoring once. He also played for the U23 team during the 2018 AFC U-23 Championship qualification, playing in all three games, as well as in two 2020 qualifications games, scoring against the Maldives in a 6–0 victory. He made his debut for the senior team on 30 July 2019, in a 1–0 defeat against Iraq at the 2019 WAFF Championship. == Personal life == On 1 October 2020, Monzer tested positive for COVID-19. He fully recovered on 15 October 2020. ==Honours== ===Club=== Ahed * AFC Cup: 2019 * Lebanese Premier League: 2016–17, 2017–18, 2018–19 * Lebanese FA Cup: 2017–18, 2018–19 * Lebanese Super Cup: 2017, 2018, 2019 === Individual === Awards * Lebanese Premier League Team of the Season: 2016–17, 2018–19 ==References== ==External links== * * * * * Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Lebanese footballers Category:Lebanon international footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Lebanese Premier League players Category:Al Ahed FC players Category:People from Marjeyoun District Category:Lebanon youth international footballers Category:AFC Cup winning players
title: Hussein Monzer
